stream_context.summary: Kaze builds and tests the Power-Plant section of the Oil world: codes elevators, treadmills and pipes; designs a Yoshi-coin puzzle and prototypes new enemy concepts (glowing Amps and psychedelic “Oil Fuzzies”) while fine-tuning performance and discussing future demos.

development_findings.summary: Elevator platform in the Power-Plant programmed as its own object; initial failure traced to overlapping duplicate platforms and missing collision, then fixed so Mario is displaced correctly.
development_findings.quote: Oh what if there were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other – that’s why it didn’t work.

development_findings.summary: Treadmill platform animated at 30 fps, speed tweaked and tile-scroll bug fixed; now runs smoothly at 60 fps after adjusting per-frame velocity and set-tile-size parameters.
Week-long micro-optimisations (function inlining, better culling) raised room performance from ~43-45 fps to 45-49 fps; a later culling tweak settled it at ~47 fps.
development_findings.quote: We went from 43 to 45 fps to the range of 45 to 49 fps.

development_findings.summary: Planning a Yoshi-coin puzzle: coin placed high in first room; player must ground-pound a hanging platform so it drops low enough to grab the coin, with generator geometry under it for theming.
Debating crate/barrel assets for breakable clutter; leaning toward fragile-marked crates inspired by Banjo-Tooie but undecided on final look.
Concept for redesigned Amps: smaller grey core with luminous sparks that light surrounding vertices; will travel along pipes and gates to reinforce ‘electric plant’ theme.

New enemy concept ‘Oil Fuzzy’: touching it triggers psychedelic wobble (view-matrix & FOV oscillation, hue rotation), audio pitch-bend, extreme squash-and-stretch and forced sliding controls – mirrors Yoshi’s Island ‘Touch Fuzzy, Get Dizzy’. Prototype effect coded live.
development_findings.quote: I think this is a very trippy effect.

development_findings.summary: Explored replacing texture-based screen transitions with SVG polygons decompressed at load-time; would save ~9 KB ROM space but adds code complexity. Decision pending.
Announced intention to release one or two small demo hacks before RTYI to lock in camera and physics after lessons from Only Up 64.
development_findings.quote: I want to release at least one hack where it’s all perfect and then I put RTYI out, because once I have RTYI out I can’t really change anything anymore.

development_findings.summary: Early vision for a Wild-West world featuring a moving train where Mario plays detective inside and fights a boss on the roof.
development_findings.quote: I want a train and you’re playing detective and then you’re having a boss fight on top of the train roof. That’d just be too cool.

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently moved; now streams from a basement office while Zeina works upstairs.
context_findings.quote: Zeina is finally out of my hair, she is upstairs now and I'm downstairs.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with constant release-date questions; prefers focusing on development progress during streams.
Channel audience has shifted toward programmers after the decompilation era; plans more technical content (e.g., one-hour video on video-game water) and April-Fools ‘shitpost’ videos.
Needs financial incentive to decompile/port Ocarina of Time; considers full-time work on it ‘irresponsible’ without funding.
context_findings.quote: I would like to do OOT next but I need financial incentive; I can’t just do it, it would be irresponsible.

context_findings.summary: Still employed at Gears for Breakfast; cannot publicly discuss the unannounced project he’s working on.
Personal release philosophy: wants mechanics and camera perfected through demos before final RTYI release.
context_findings.quote: Once I have RTYI out I can’t really change anything anymore that much.

biobak.summary: Will overhaul textures for the Power-Plant later; current visuals considered placeholder.
Provided a fixed GeoLayout for vanilla Amp, but Kaze intends to create entirely new Amp assets.

zeina.summary: Not directly involved in this session’s tasks; personal dynamic joked about (separate workspaces upstairs/downstairs).

key_stories.title: The Stubborn Elevator
key_stories.summary: An elevator in the Power-Plant refused to move Mario. Kaze debugged live, discovering he had accidentally placed two identical platforms and omitted collision data.
key_stories.challenge: Elevator platform failed to displace Mario, suggesting a deeper engine bug.
key_stories.process: Re-compiled, inspected platform list, found overlapping duplicates and missing collision; removed extra object and added collision.
key_stories.outcome: Elevator now moves correctly and forms part of the room’s traversal.
key_stories.key_quote: There were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other – that’s why it didn’t work.

key_stories.title: Squeezing Out Frames
key_stories.summary: Kaze devoted part of the week to micro-optimisations, inlining functions and improving culling, gaining several frames per second in the busiest room.
key_stories.challenge: Power-Plant area ran at ~43 fps, below the 60 fps target.
key_stories.process: Profiled, inlined small functions, removed redundancies, tweaked culling parameters.
key_stories.outcome: Performance rose to 45-49 fps (later 47 after further tweaks), giving headroom for added effects.
key_stories.key_quote: We went from 43 to 45 fps to the range of 45 to 49 fps.

key_stories.title: Touch Fuzzy, Get Dizzy – 2024 Edition
key_stories.summary: While searching for a signature enemy, Kaze re-imagined Yoshi’s Island’s ‘Fuzzy’ as an oil-covered variant that causes visual and control chaos.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a memorable Power-Plant enemy that fits the Yoshi’s Island homage.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed effects (rainbow oil, slippery movement, audio warp), experimented with view-matrix distortion and FOV modulation live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on the ‘Oil Fuzzy’: contact triggers psychedelic screen wobble, hue cycling, slowed music, extreme squash-and-stretch and forced sliding. Implementation scheduled for next session.
key_stories.key_quote: This is a very trippy effect.
